October 2008 edition:
New Customers and New Upgrades
We are pleased to welcome several new members to the IntApp community and acknowledge existing customers who have acquired additional IntApp products or licenses.
Integration Builder: K&L Gates LLP Norton Rose LLP
Risk -- Wall Builder/ADAM: Andrews Kurth LLP Goodmans LLP McCarthy Tetrault LLP Vinson & Elkins L.L.P.
Time Builder: Addleshaw Goddard LLP Kilpatrick Stockton LLP
Announcing Virtualized Product Line
We are very excited to announce the release of our virtualized product line. All of our products now support VMware ESX and ESXi servers. For existing clients who are interested in going virtual, we are introducing a Virtualization Migration Program that allows clients to switch to a virtual IntApp environment at no additional licensing fee. The program is available through the end of this year. If you are interested in moving from hardware to software, please email Jennifer Chia at jennifer.chia@intapp.com.
Wall Builder 3.4
IntApp is excited to announce the availability of Wall Builder v3.4. This release adds the ability to secure matter and client sites in Microsoft Office SharePoint. By using Wall Builder in conjunction with SharePoint Server 2007, law firms will be able to deliver timely, accurate and relevant information to attorneys and staff, while minimizing the risk of individuals inadvertently accessing restricted materials or falling out of compliance with internal policies. Other new features include:
Extension to Interwoven Records Manager
Expanded international character support
Integration Builder 4.1
We are pleased to announce the availability of Integration Builder 4.1.2. This release offers additional VMware improvements and full international character support.
Additionally, a new category of rule templates for working with Microsoft Office SharePoint 2007 has been published on the IntApp Resource Center at https://www.intapp.com/resourceCenter. These templates enable users to automate common SharePoint tasks such as managing lists and creating sites. Take a look and see how your firm can join the host of IntApp clients already using IntApp to help with SharePoint portal management.
Time Builder 2.5
Time Builder 2.5 was released with several new enhancements including UI improvements and extended desktop and blackberry capture. We recently sponsored and attended the Redwood Analytics User Conference and Paul Zengilowski, head of IntApp's Revenue Practice Group, led a CFO roundtable on time capture. The session explored timekeeping styles and practices, with the goal of identifying sustainable approaches, policies, incentives and tools to help attorneys capture more billable hours and enter those hour more reliably.
IntApp at ILTA 2008
IntApp had a very strong presence at ILTA this year. We had 20 team members attend and we sponsored both TV channels. We would like to extend a big thank you to the following firms for participating in new videos this year:
Becker & Poliakoff P.A. Berwin Leighton Paisner LLP Lawrence Graham LLP Loeb & Loeb LLP Reed Smith LLP Stikeman Elliott LLP
We connected with many firms at ILTA, and saw several familiar faces and plenty of new ones. The highlight of the week was our annual wine tasting event, where we hosted over 225 guests. Thank you to everyone who attended!
Risk Survey
Last year we sponsored a risk management survey and received an excellent response. Participants included a variety of risk stakeholders including general counsel, loss prevention, risk management and conflicts personnel at 80 AmLaw 200 firms.
This year we are sponsoring another risk management survey, and we are extending participation to IT audiences, as technology factors heavily into firm risk management issues. If you would like a copy of of our report from last year or would like to learn more about the 2008 program, please email info@riskroundtable.com
New IntApp Team Members
We're pleased to welcome Jon Roscow to the IntApp team. Jon is our new General Manager of the EMEA region. Prior to IntApp, Jon spent several years at Billback Systems, a leading provider of cost management and cost recovery solutions for law firms, serving as general manager for EMEA. At Billback, he drove the success of the EMEA business unit, achieving significant revenue growth and greatly expanding the company's market presence in the United Kingdom.
Previous to Billback, Jon held several leadership roles in companies including Sweet and Maxwell, provider of integrated information and IP solutions to business and law firm clients, and Clara.Net. Our UK clients can reach Jon at jon.roscow@intapp.com
IntApp welcomes John Sharkey to the team as the Sales Director of the Risk Practice. John joins IntApp with twenty years of legal software sales and marketing experience. John was co-founder and President of Chase Technologies, Inc. from 1990-1999. Chase developed Records Management and Conflicts software for law firms, corporate legal departments, and corporate records management departments.
After selling his company in 1999, John served as Vice President of Marketing for Rainmaker Software for three years. He has spent the past six years as Industry Solutions Director for MDY and CA, Inc. in the Information Governance Solution Sales Group. He was responsible for North American Sales in the Law Firm Vertical Market. John can be reached at john.sharkey@intapp.com.
